entry.title: Combined summary - Batch exchange withdrawal to lightning requires covenants
entry.summary: The email discusses a protocol that enables batched withdrawals from exchanges into lightning wallets using covenants. It addresses the challenges of requiring signatures from multiple users and proposes a workaround to ensure user control over funds. The protocol aims to minimize on-chain transactions and simplify the withdrawal process. In this scenario, the commitment transaction is not used. Instead, a new approach is proposed where the wallet user provides a signature for only the new funding output and does not sign the commitment transaction. This allows the user to maintain control over their funds and prevents the wallet provider from blackmailing them. The author acknowledges that they were unable to find a clever solution to the problem of using the `txid` of the batch transaction because it is unknown at that point. However, they propose using `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` as a solution. They also mention that the rotation of funding keys at each splice ensures that signature reuse is not an issue. The author believes that most other forms of covenants also address this problem. The email concludes by stating that further analysis is needed to evaluate the security implications of this protocol.
